intro: Synotis saluenensis, commonly known as the Saluenes sedge, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, grasses, and rushes. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountain meadows and wetlands. Synotis saluenensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
